abstract: Law firm Cravath, Swaine & Moore raises annual salary of first-year lawyers to $180,000 from $160,000; also raises salary for other associates; increase, first of its kind in almost ten years, will likely push other prestigious firms to follow suit or risk losing top recruits.

headline.print_headline: With Pay Jumps at Elite Firm, Junior Lawyers Share Spoils
headline.main: Law Firm Salaries Jump for the First Time in Nearly a Decade

snippet: The elite New York firm Cravath, Swaine & Moore said it had raised salaries for associates by $20,000 to $35,000, increases that other major firms are likely to match.
lead_paragraph: The elite New York firm Cravath, Swaine & Moore said it had raised salaries for associates by $20,000 to $35,000, increases that other major firms are likely to match.
